title: TRENDS IN MODERN OPERATIONS MANAGEMENT
abstractText:
Global competition requires the adoption of modern management initiatives to deliver enhanced quality and cost effectiveness in UK business operations. It is believed that by improving operations management practices, the UK will have a better means of fighting competition from low cost-economies than through protectionism. Current popular trends in operations management include 6-Sigma for quality management, knowledge management, project and process management, E-business, service provision, and lean and agile thinking.

The aim of this seminar series was to enlighten people about the above current trends affecting the UK. Each seminar focused upon a different trend. The objectives were to:

  • present industrial and academic perspectives about trends in operations management
  • discuss why these trends have occurred and their future potential impact for the UK economy and society
  • create a research agenda to help prepare the UK to cope with such trends.

This seminar series has debated the above current trends, their impact upon operations management and shared emerging best practices. The seminars involved a mixture of academics, consultants, managers and students. The seminars disseminated the latest initiatives and influenced materials for publication in quality research journals and text books; and helped set an agenda for further research.
